Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, clean, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: OlgaMo
Reviews.Content: Apart from its ideal location (Taksim square, surrounded by interesting restaurants) and its interior charm, the hotel has the kindest staff I have met. On our first day, the person in the breakfast room (which is, though, one of the not so intriguing areas of the hotel) didn't only let us eat, despite our 30min delay, he even brought back warm food and made us coffee. While I was ill, the concierge escorted my boyfriend to three restaurants, in order to help him find me a soup, while his colleague made me his special herb-honey-lemon tea! The rooms are clean, pleasant and elegant, although one might need earplugs at night. Free internet, comfortable beds, overall a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “A great choice especially for 2-3 day business trip”
Reviews.Author: HaythamKawar
Reviews.Content: A cozy hotel, very clean, 30 seconds away from Istiklal street the lively pedestrian street. The breakfast is not perfect maybe because the hotel doesn't have a lot of rooms..however it's fair enough. The room was not big but it had a lot of useful facilities.. A great value for the money I paid and I will defiantly use this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Value for money at an advantageous location for travel, food and shopping.”
Reviews.Author: ILNature
Reviews.Content: We, a family of five adults were visiting Turkey on holidays and stayed in this hotel in mid Oct.2011 for 3 nights. The hotel was selected on the basis of travellerâ€™s reviews and recommendation of local friend. It offered reasonable room rent including free airport pick-up and breakfast. On arrival at Ataturk International airport at 9:30am, and after immigration we were greeted by the hotel arranged pick-up van driver. Check-in was quick. Both double and triple occupancy rooms allotted to us were in good condition, had adequately large beds, clean linen and working gadgets. The bathrooms were indeed large with majestic sanitary fittings, running hot water, shower cabin and clean Turkish towels. Free WiFi connectivity on each floor was strong and available. Breakfast was ready early in the morning and had wide variety of sumptuous items to choose from for vegetarians like us. Also, in its vicinity there are varieties of vegetarian restaurants for meals. The hotel has an advantageous location near the Taksim Square which is the hub of the public transport services that helped us in saving cost of travel and minimise travel time through the hustle and bustle of the city during working days. The noise level in the rooms was low as the hotel is in the side street parallel to the busy shopping and active night life of Istiklal street. The staffs were courteous and friendly. In particular the front desk staff arranged to provide us free airport drop service early in the morning of the departure day to catch 7:00am flight to Kayseri, Turkey interiors. This was arranged meticulously and on-time. Our special thanks to them - teÅŸekkÃ¼r ederim.

Reviews.Title: “Ripped off!”
Reviews.Author: Betty B
Reviews.Content: Our Lonely Planet guide listed this hotel. With that reference we booked a room for 2 nights for more than $350. The day before we were due to catch our early flight to the airport, my husband paid $55 cash to the hotel manager to arrange our shuttle to the airport with a pickup time of 6 a.m. to get there in time for our flight to the U.S. At 6:05 a.m., the recommended shuttle had not arrived. I asked the manager to call the shuttle service to confirm they were enroute. He got off the phone and told us they were "just leaving" the tax station at the Sofia... and would be there in 10 minutes. 10 minutes later, no shuttle. I am fuming so the manager leaves the hotel to stand at the thoroughfare a block away, I assume to get away from us and hail the shuttle should it ever appear. Finally, at 6:30 a.m. we hailed a taxi that raced to the airport to catch our flight. Of course, we never got our $55 refunded because the front desk guy never returned before we left!!! I emailed him once we got home and he promised to refund us with a credit to our credit card, but that would have to be approved and he was off tomorrow, and the next day was a holiday, and then there was the weekend, but he would for sure get back to me by Monday. He never did. I emailed several times. No response. Since it was cash I can't even get my credit card company to credit the hotel bill charge.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel of best value”
Reviews.Author: Krisztina V
Reviews.Content: Lies just one corner away from Istikal Cadesi in the heart of the city with excellent connections. The rooms are a bit overheated in winter (like in most of hotels of Turkey), but well-equipped and very clean. Breakfast is served until 1 pm during the week-ends, which sounds more likely a brunch than a breakfast. Service is not the best, receptionist are not flexible and some don't speak English, but this won't keep me away to return! Best value!

Reviews.Title: “TOTALLY RECOMMENDED!!!”
Reviews.Author: celia715
Reviews.Content: I staye'd there for 3nights with my friends and we had a great time. The rooms were spacious,the decoration very nice and the most important..very clean!! The breakfast was just ok...nothing special and not a big variety. And as for the location?? Just a step away from Istiklal road.. I totally recommend it to everyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and convenient”
Reviews.Author: emalogue
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 4 days, 2 minutes walk from Taxim Square. Very clean and nice, and affordable, too. Overall, I'm very happy to had stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “4 star quality at half the price - definately worth it”
Reviews.Author: AmaCha81
Reviews.Content: Stayed with family for 4 days. In retrospect the area may not have been the best one for our needs, still the hotel was 1 minute away from the central Taksim square. The room was small but very practical and very recently renovated with an excellent spacious bathroom. Cleaning was thorough and very frequent. The heating was off but we requested it back on. The service was simply superb - reception staff super friendly and helpful. Do not expect Oxford English, but do expect them to bend over backwards to answer any questions and do all that's necessary for a memorable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacations in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Stan_ru
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in May with friends (7 pax). Great location - 50 meters for a walk to Istiklal Caddesi and very close to Taksim Square. Hotel organized for our group the transfer from and to airport - very easy to book and punctually. Try to choose upper rooms because of noise from night disco especially in weekends. Breakfast very simple. There is a small kitchen in all rooms. Friendly staff. Free Wi-Fi. Goog value for money. Next time we will stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great and cosy 7 days!”
Reviews.Author: firemode
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 7 days and loved it: Location is less than couple minutes away from istiklal caddesi, and 4-5 mins to taxim square. Shops are close around and restaurants too! Friendly staff and it's manager Fikret bey was very friendly with all guests too! Breakfast was just good. Free wifi made life even better!

Reviews.Title: “Will be staying again!”
Reviews.Author: Fireland93
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 7 nights in April, travelled for spending some time in Istanbul for fun. It's Less than couple minutes to Istiklal Caddesi and very close to Taxim square. Location is great! I read reviews from this site before going to Istanbul. We stayed in an upper floor and was really good, as much noise wasn't bothering me. Breakfast was just good and friendly staff. Free wi-fi makes life even better in this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “would be back”
Reviews.Author: brook38
Reviews.Content: Great find the staff were very helpful and gave us very good recommendations where to eat and I must we were'nt disappointed. The room was well appointed and the bed was very comfy. I must say the general manager was great and very professional. Would deffo be back.

Reviews.Title: “terrible”
Reviews.Author: yalelli
Reviews.Content: worst hotel ever, airconditioning didn't work, very much noise, bad front desk staff,escpecially the male in the night, arrogant, very small rooms, dont recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “I Found there all i need - excellent”
Reviews.Author: egyptian_tourist1975
Reviews.Content: i stayed there at february 2010 & went again to the same hotel this month an excellent hotal to stay at istanbol , excellent location for shopping , night life & transportation very comfotable rooms with comfortable clean beds , the stuff is very freindly & willing to serve you quickly for any requirment the price is very good compared to the same hotel range at the same location

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Reforma
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 nights. Price - absolutely reasonable. Very convenient location - 5 minutes walk from the Havas airport shuttle station at Taksim - you can save on taxi. Rooms are clean and in a good shape. Breakfast is better than in some 4 and 5 * hotels in Istanbul. Serpil - general manager takes very good care of all guests. I highly recommend this hotel to eveyone.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: shaygi
Reviews.Content: very nice rooms and beautiful and large bathrooms with a lot of thought into the design down to the small things. service is very friendly and personal - staff incredibly nice, great location close to Istiklal and Taxim but location brings also the problem of noise - light sleepers should be aware loud music resonates in all rooms well into the night weekends and weekdays making it difficult to fall a sleep

Reviews.Title: “everything you needed at the right price -- location, comfort + service”
Reviews.Author: sirtravel
Reviews.Content: I spent six nights at the Santa Ottoman Hotel and it was excellent. I stayed in a single room for Euro 80 per night inclusive of breakfast and had a lovely top floor room with double bed with a view onto the pedestrian streets that line the hotel entrance. The service is exceptionally helpful and make the visit that much more enjoyable. My room had a memory foam mattress and pillow and I don't recall having a better hotel sleep. While the hotel is right off the heart of Taksim Square and it's 24 hour activity, I actually was not disturbed by the noise. I closed my window and put on the AC and slept like a baby on the memory foam mattress. And the advantage of the location is that you are in the heart of one of Istanbul's primary night life and entertainment areas and you have great bars and restaurants literally steps away from your front door. And it was easy to visit the other parts of Istanbul since you also have access to many modes of public transport right in Taksim Square.

Reviews.Title: “At the heart of Istanbul's day - and night - life”
Reviews.Author: mk13
Reviews.Content: This is the hotel you need if you want to spend a few days in Istanbul and enjoy the liveliness of the city. LOCATION: a It is a couple of minutes away from Istiklal Caddesi, the most famous pedestrian street in town , full of shops, cafes and restaurants open until late at night. however, maybe because our room was located at the 4th floor, the noise of the night life was not bothering. Taksim square is very close: from there it is possible to get buses to both airports, metro, and, above all, the historic cable car. Walking to Sultanahmet, the historic heart of Istanbul, was also duable. HOTEL: really clean rooms, rich breakfast buffet, extremely friendly personnel. Profi cook Bulat introduced us to typical breakfast delicacies; the assistance of Serpil (the hotel manager) and Murat at the reception desk was particularly appreciated during the extra days we had to remain in Istanbul because of volcanic ashes. Unforgettable! A big thank to you all guys!

Reviews.Title: “A very serviceable, clean, professional hotel”
Reviews.Author: creige
Reviews.Content: This is a great practical solution. It's clean and well maintained, in a great location near Taxim Square. You're a block from the main pedestrian promenade and among side streets with great little cafes and restaurants. The staff is very friendly and competent. The rooms are a bit small, but comfortable. The bathrooms are nice. There was a little noise from the nearby disco one night, but it wasn't that bad. My girlfriend's company picked up the tab for a conference. It's a bit more pricey than we usually pay but served as a good introduction to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “very good indded”
Reviews.Author: habiba1418
Reviews.Content: just a little bit noise but it was St Valentin's day and night. Very clean, staff very helpfull, locates central andnear of all you need, very nice room and commodities, super breakfast, the manager is a very great lady!!!

Reviews.Title: “The best choice”
Reviews.Author: Mariadim
Reviews.Content: Everything was great. The location couldn't be better, very central and close to metro. The room was very clean and confortable. The staff very kind and helpfull. For sur it was value for money and I'll be back at my next trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Top value in Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: Hashem_Saleh
Reviews.Content: Everything inside the hotel looks new & clean .The rooms were very clean and comfortable. Hotel offers transit for visitors from airport. As a welcome drink, all soft drinks of a minibar in the room are free charge. Location very convenient the near Taksim square, close to lots of restaurants and the popular shopping street Istiklal. Easy Metro access. The price of the room is not expensive and if you are planning on having more cash to shop instead, this is the place to be.Small team of staff but very helpful & friendly. The manager Ms. Serpil an absolute delight to the hotel guests. I enjoyed dealing with her during my stay at Santa Ottoman Boutique Hotel. I would recommend this Hotel for your next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect city break in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: razbibriga
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in perfect location, very central. The staff are very helpful and friendly, and the hotel is lovely decorated and the rooms are brand new, and very nicely decorated, everything is just like on the pictures and hotel website, just even better! They offer transfer from or to the airport, and I would say that the transfer to the hotel is more important, as the airport is huge, and you simply want to settle down as smooth as possible - everything went perfectly well. We also asked them to arrange transfer on our way back, and it was also nice, and cheap - around 25 euros for two of us. Breakfast is good, and different every day, I liked it very much, as it is an opportunity to try some local specialties as well. The hotel restaurant is very good, with great barbecue, and also very good prices, you have to try it! The rooms are not that small considering that this is a central, city hotel. It is a bit noisy during the night, as there is a night club near by, but we had no problem sleeping. If you do not like noise, do not go to Istanbul, go to spa or countryside :) We got a nice fruit basket for New Year! Wi-Fi is also working well in the rooms, and it is free of charge. Taksim square offers broad range of possibilities for exploring the city, as you can choose bus, metro, trams or taxis to go anywhere you want. Taxis are very cheap for a European city, we haven't paid more than 10 euros for any taxi ride. You can also walk to Sultanahmet if you like, it is around 5 km, but with so many things to see it is a very nice walking tour. You can also walk to Dolmabahce palace, even to Ortakoy or Fenar . I would really recommend this hotel to everyone who wants to see the best of Istanbul, and feel like it's citizen - as it's central location offers blending in, not like in some other areas (close to Grand Bazaar, for e.g.), where you cannot get rid of annoying shoe "cleaners", and souvenir sellers, and where everything is written on Russian or Italian, just to make the tourists feel like at "home" and buy as much as possible. As shopping was not our main preference, we wanted to avoid that hassle and explore the sites and the city. I would like to come here again!

Reviews.Title: “Will go there again!”
Reviews.Author: Ediba
Reviews.Content: Hotel is great, staff is friendly and helpful. You certainly get your value for money, whether you book online or directly with the hotel. Rooms are very cosy (see photos), new furniture and most importantly, hotel is very, very clean. All the staff is very friendly and at your disposal, from waiters, reception staff to manager Serpil. After our four days stay, we have decided this is going to be "our Istanbul hotel" that we will be coming back to whenever there. Location is perfect, just off the main street which makes it less noisy and enables you to sleep, yet just few steps away from the main happening. Breakfast is nice, buffet type and you can additionally order anything you want. The option of pick up at the airport if you are staying more than 3 nights is very nice and it was comforting to see the sign with your name at a busy airport in Istanbul. Hotel is very near Taksim square (5min walk) where you can get the metro, bus, taxi to go to other parts of the city. Really enjoyed this stay and will hopefully be going there soon again.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: ErolLeiden
Reviews.Content: I recommend hotel to my friends and family. Scoring in the price-quality ratio is very high.

Reviews.Title: “Two perfect stays!”
Reviews.Author: Earthtripper
Reviews.Content: My friend and myself had booked two rooms, at the Santa Ottoman, for one night, in the middle of a two-week trip to Turkey. We were so impressed by our welcome, and the rooms, that we decided to return, at the end of our trip, for two further nights. The Santa Ottoman is expertly run by the lovely Serpil. This lady is a gem - the hotel (and friendliness of the staff) is a reflection of her warm, friendly and professional attitude! Nothing was too much trouble! The recently renovated Santa Ottoman is pristene. The beautiful rooms are of good size and have small balconies and the beds are excellent, having the type of mattresses which just hug the body. The Santa Ottoman is situated at the corner of two side-streets, only 30 seconds walk from the pedestrianised Istiklal Street and only two minutes from Taksim Square. Trams, buses and the Metro are all at hand. Although in the centre of things, with bars, restaurants and shops on the doorstep, the Santa Ottoman is a quiet hotel which provides an excellent base for visiting this wonderful cosmopolitan city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent four stars hotel”
Reviews.Author: hebmash
Reviews.Content: I stayed in santa ottoman with my family for one week, everything was perfect; the rooms were very clean (blankets and bathrooms) and smell nice and the staff members were really helpful and freindly BUT we had a problem with the safe it was not working and they tried to fix it but it stayed for the whole week unworking. Its a very small hotel about 20 rooms only so it was very quiet and we felt like we stayed at home but there were no connected rooms. Overall the whole hotel was VERY CLEAN but actually it was just reconstructed before my visit so thats why it was so clean. The location is PERFECT, it is located in a small quiet street about 200 meters or less from Istiklal street and about 500 meters from taksim square where you can find the bus stop or metro. Concerning the breakfast it was not that perfect but it was good. If I visit Istanbul again I'll definately stay at Santa ottoman Botique..

HotelInfo.Name: Santa Ottoman Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Sehit muhtar mahallesi Kurabiye/Zambak sokak no 1 | Beyoglu, Istanbul 34500, Turkey
